title: Russian Forces Strike Back Against Ukraine’s Counteroffensive
description: Russia attacked Ukrainian troops near villages in Ukraine’s south on the same day that Russian missiles killed at least 11 people and that President Vladimir V. Putin acknowledged some Russian losses.

title: Nigerian Wedding Boat Ride Ends in Tragedy, With at Least 103 Dead
description: The boat capsized on the Niger River at night, when many passengers were returning from a wedding party.

title: Colombian Children Found in Jungle Had Been on Plane to Flee Armed Group
description: The father of two of the survivors said the family had feared the children would be recruited by a violent armed group.

title: U.N. Monitor Aims to Cross Front Line to Inspect Ukrainian Nuclear Plant
description: The destruction of a hydroelectric dam last week unleashed a flood and threatened the water supply needed to cool the battle-scarred Zaporizhzhia plant.

title: Yellen Says Bid to Decouple From China Would Be ‘Disastrous’
description: The Treasury secretary, speaking to a House committee, said trade and investment were crucial in U.S.-Chinese relations.

title: C.I.A. Told Ukraine Last Summer It Should Not Attack Nord Stream Pipelines
description: Dutch intelligence officials shared information with the C.I.A. in June 2022 that they had learned the Ukrainian military had been planning an operation using divers to blow up one of the pipelines.

title: U.S. Soldiers Injured in Syria Were Part of Commando Unit
description: Ten members of the Army’s elite Delta Force unit were flown to Germany for medical treatment after a helicopter accident.

title: U.K. Woman Sentenced to Prison for Abortion in Eighth Month of Pregnancy
description: The case has prompted heated debate in England, with some arguing that abortion pills should not be available by mail and others maintaining that abortion should be fully decriminalized.

title: Biden Will Meet NATO Chief Today to Discuss Ukraine and Succession
description: Succession plans at the military alliance is expected to be on their agenda as Jens Stoltenberg says he is stepping down in September.

title: Berlusconi Seizes Italy’s Attention Even in Death
description: A day after Silvio Berlusconi’s death, some Italians said goodbye, others said good riddance, and many debated whether the billionaire and former prime minister did more good or bad for Italy.

title: As Egypt Faces Crisis, President el-Sisi Tries Talks With Opposition
description: The rare — and tightly constrained — outreach is a sign that President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi may be feeling the pressure of rising discontent and a sinking economy.

title: New Zealand’s Public Broadcaster Investigates Pro-Russia Changes to Some Articles
description: A web editor for RNZ has been put on leave and the station has apologized for changes to articles by Reuters and the BBC that had been published on its website.

title: Man Arrested After 3 Killed in Nottingham, UK Police Say
description: The police in the English city arrested one man, giving few details but saying they believed the deaths and injuries to be linked. The investigation closed major roads and some public transportation.

title: Russia Targets Central Ukraine in Deadly Aerial Attack
description: Ukrainian officials said at least 10 people were killed and 28 injured on Tuesday in a strike that hit buildings in Kryvyi Rih, a city already reeling from the Kakhovka dam disaster.

title: How Democrats Can Win Workers
description: We’re covering a new poll about the Democratic Party, Donald Trump’s court appearance and the N.B.A. finals.

title: Thousands of Brides in India Are Abandoned by Husbands Overseas
description: Thousands of Indian women have been abandoned by men working overseas, leaving them trapped in their in-laws’ homes and often defrauded of dowry money.

title: Every Block Is Another Battle: Ukraine’s Latest Eastern Stand
description: Outnumbered, outgunned, out-tanked, Ukraine is putting up a scrappy defense of Marinka, another city near Bakhmut that is a few blocks from falling.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: NATO air drills in Germany.

title: 22 U.S. Troops Are Hurt in Helicopter ‘Mishap’ in Syria
description: The military provided few details about the accident, saying the troops had sustained “injuries of various degrees.”

title: Cuban Government Is Responsible for Death of Oswaldo Payá, Report Says
description: The findings in the death of Oswaldo Payá contradict the Cuban government’s official version of what happened 11 years ago.
